snippet: American and Pakistani officials, without discussing details, voiced cautious optimism that a deal to reopen the routes into Afghanistan was near after a seven-month stalemate.
abstract: American and Pakistani officials voice cautious optimism that a deal to reopen NATO’s supply routes into neighboring Afghanistan is near, a move that would end a seven-month stalemate between the two countries.
lead_paragraph: American and Pakistani officials, without discussing details, voiced cautious optimism that a deal to reopen the routes into Afghanistan was near after a seven-month stalemate.

headline.seo: U.S. and Pakistan Hint at Afghan Supply Route Deal
headline.main: U.S. and Pakistan Hint at Deal to Reopen NATO Supply Routes
headline.print_headline: U.S. and Pakistan Offer Hints That Supply Route Deal Is Near

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
keywords.name: subject
